result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shacel Ahmad Trotter

defendant.name: Trotter, Shacel Ahmad
defendant.address: 2767 North Pierce Street, lower, Milwaukee, WI 53212

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 9-28-22

Defendant Shacel A Trotter in court with attorney Connor Romenesko. Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing with Defendant's other cases 22CF206 and 21CM2734. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense counsel and Defendant. For reasons stated on the record, Plea hearing began, but could not be finished. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing hearing, Branch 40. Plea/Sentencing hearing scheduled December 14, 2022 at 2:00 pm. Hearing will be held IN PERSON in room 634 of the Courthouse.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in Court for a status conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-14-2022
All other previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Shacel Ahmad Trotter not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court accepts transfer of defendant's pending misdemeanor case for global resolution.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shacel Ahmad Trotter in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko; both appear by video.  Defendant Shacel Ahmad Trotter in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No driving.

Defendant Shacel Ahmad Trotter in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Shacel Ahmad Trotter in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shacel Ahmad Trotter appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
